election_record.label: Pennsylvania 1813 U.S. House of Representatives, District 13, Special

overview.note: Election to fill the seat of John Smiie, deceased.

"To Nathaniel B. Boileau, Esquire, Secretary of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, At a special election held on the 16th instant in the counties of Fayette and Greene composing the thirteenth District for a representative in the Congress of the United States, and after comparing and casting up tho' several returns, Isaac Griffin, Esquire, had seven hundred and seventy nine votes of a majority given under our hands and seals this 23rd February 1813." Original Election Certificate.
